name: Hyatt Regency O'Hare

reviews.text: We paid $55 per night through Priceline, and that was a fair price for what we received. I am less than impressed with the so-called "luxury" of this hotel. Another reviewer compared the Hyatt Regency O'Hare to a Holiday Inn; that's an appropriate comparison.
reviews.title: Style over substance

likes.disliked: — Overall ease and comfort

reviews.text: The building is ugly, inside and out, but they renovated it as best they could. The room (including the bathroom) was small but seemed clean and taken care of. Our room smelled funny, but I couldn't tell if it was cleaning products or just that the room was musty. I agree that Priceline customers get put in the cheap rooms. Entertaining in the room is difficult due to the size and few places to sit other than the bed. We didn't receive a newspaper, and I wonder if it's because we're Priceline customers. The walls are thin and you can hear everyone else's phone calls, tv and other "activities." The planes are loud but we didn't hear them after 11pm. The air conditioner isn't loud enough to drown out the noise, so if you're a light sleeper (like myself) bring something else that makes white noise.
reviews.title: Better than expected ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A huge red flag for me was the bed. It was comfortable, but poorly made. They don't use fitted sheets, just flat sheets. Ok, that should be fine, except that the cleaning staff just stuffed the sheets and duvet under the mattress so when you pull back the top sheet, ALL of the bed linens came untucked. We saw the bare mattress. I have never in my life had to remake a bed in a hotel, or motel for that matter. The sheets weren't big enough for the bed, so in the night, all the sheets came untucked and we were, again, on the bare mattress. The duvet isn't in a real duvet cover, but tucked between two flat sheets. Of course the duvet and the sheets became separated. It was shoddy work, and showed a real lack of care from both the management who purchased the linens and the cleaning staff who made the bed.
reviews.title: "Special" Priceline rooms

likes.disliked: — "Special" Priceline rooms

reviews.text: We knew not to touch the minibar after reading this site, so we had no problems there. Parking is $17 a day. We only parked one day, but were charged for two. We had no problems getting the extra charge taken off our bill.
reviews.title: Good Priceline hotel!

likes.disliked: — no pool, resturant was very expensive & had to pay for parking $17/night.

reviews.title: No complaints but nothing to rave about either
reviews.text: We didn't eat at the restaurant or bar, but did sample the coffee/gift shop downstairs. The prices were comparable to other chain coffee shops. They offer Starbucks coffee, bagels, muffins, juice, water, milk, ice cream, etc.

The room was clean with modern furnishings. Only the parking garage, garage elevator, walkway from the garage to the building, and vending area showed the building's true age. I was pleasantly suprised to enter such a beautifully remodeled atrium/lobby after having come through the dinosaur-age garage facility. I checked in at 11pm and a room was available--no problem. The bed was comfortable and the shower was hot with great water pressure. I only stayed one night, but overall--great value for the hotwire price of $105 (89 + taxes and fees). I wished I could have stayed longer to try out the 24hour fitness room and restaurant. One thing to note: parking is not free. $20 for daily, $17 for overnight guests. Ticket must be validated at the front desk.
reviews.title: Nice Short Stay

reviews.text: Bottom Line: I'd stay again.
reviews.title: Hip, chic hotel with excellent service... Hyatt has done it!

likes.liked: — Updates to the hotel and the service. Customer Service was the best I've seen in a very long time...
likes.disliked: — I'm upset that I haven't stayed here before

reviews.title: Amazing Transformation!
reviews.text: I will not stay anywhere else when traveling into Chicago. Hyatt has taken customer service and attention to detail to another level. It's really great to see a hip, chic, elegent hotel with an affordable pricetag. The food at O'h is excellent - you must try the pulled pork sandwiches, cucumber salad. Oh yeah, I must not forget the perfectly poured martinis in the lounge. What a great stay!!!

reviews.title: If you like plane noise, stay here.
reviews.text: The overall look and feel of the Hyatt Regency O'Hare is outstanding. Apparently the hotel just completed an extensive renovation and all I can say is WOW!

The service and atmosphere within the restaurant (O'H American Grill) was truly remarkable. Not to mention the food - I had a steak that was to die for!! Afterward, we enjoyed a cocktail in Red Bar - the scene was very upbeat.
reviews.title: Do Not Stay Here...Ever!!!

likes.liked: — The coffee house served yummy cofee & tea.
likes.disliked: — If you do have a disability & have a need for something, be ready for a wait if you need something.

reviews.text: I like the hotel, it may have weird shaped rooms but I end up with the nice ones in the executive wing. I am thinking about getting a suite next time. After all this is fun travel not my normal get in and get out business travel.
reviews.title: Yet another excellent stay

reviews.text: The room was comfortable like last time. I loved the extra pillows. The fridge/mini-bar was okay but I didn't use it since I discovered it late. I enjoyed the room service, the hotel restaurant and the hotel bar. I used the bellhops to get my friend's and mine luggage up to the room like last time.
reviews.title: Great Stay @ Hyatt - Silencio Senorita!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was having lots of fun and so ended up kicking back at the restaurant for meals or the hotel bar.
reviews.title: Great stay and good value

reviews.text: The cool thing this year was that they had sushi in the bar 5 nights a week and enjoyed it one night. Alas that was the same night we got the server who ignored us. I should have known something was up when the manager brought over our sushi and it was confirmed when he refused to look me in the eyes twice. I dumped a guess of the cost of the meal and drinks on the table and left.
reviews.title: the staff is the best part

reviews.text: In the mornings, I would go down to the coffee shop and sometimes in the evening get drinks and snacks. I loved it and almost broke down and got one of the delicious looking brownies but didn't. Yep, creature comforts on the road when I have time on my hand, a great thing.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have stayed at many Hyatts, and this property was a BIG disappointment. The lobby and elevator areas were filthy, dirty room service trays littered the hallways, and the walls were so thin we could hear conversations of rooms around us as clearly as if they had been in our room!!
reviews.title: Big Disappointment

likes.disliked: — Surly, Unhelpful Staff, Loud and Dirty!!

reviews.text: What is more, this hotel has a very disappointing range of amenities and ridiculous prices on room service ($3.00 for a can of Pepsi!! Not Joke!). The Concierge desk was well hidden and when we asked for services of a concierge, we were directed to call their "Perfect Stay" line which consisted of surly, unhelpful staff!!
reviews.title: Average
No!
reviews.text: If we stay in the O'Hare area of Chicago again, we will avoid this Hyatt at all costs.

reviews.title: Under Construction
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights for a conference that was held at the hotel.

Check in was okay, but they had no "normal" rooms left, so they put me in a room with just a rollaway, I think it was the center part of a suite. I got a $30 voucher for room service because of it, but it still seemed odd that they didn't have any king rooms left - I know several people this happened to. I was moved to a king room the next day.
reviews.title: Jailhouse rock

likes.disliked: — The remoteness - from the world.

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency O’Hare in mid-September after “winning” the hotel via priceline. I chose the O’Hare area because I knew I could get a good rate, and all the hotels were near the blue line to downtown. I ended up getting the Hyatt for less than $60 a night, over half off their prevailing rates. I was a little skeptical after reading the reviews on here; however, I am happy to say my stay was great! I arrived to the hotel at about 10am after taking the blue line one stop from the airport. It was about a 6-8 minute walk from the station to the hotel, not bad at all. First impression was good, the lobby was very nice and open, with lots of places to sit and relax. I went up to one of the agents to try to check in and to my luck; they had rooms available (The hotel also has self service check in/out kiosks). Check-in was very quick and effortless, with no mention of priceline. I asked for a room that looked out towards the direction the airplanes land, and was given a room in the “executive tower”. The “executive tower” is the “L” shaped tower sort of behind the main complex. You go through the atrium and down a hall to get to the elevators for the executive tower. There were 3 elevators for the tower. My room was on the “27th” floor, which technically was the 7th floor, at the far end of the hallway, and was non-smoking as requested. The room had everything I needed, and was well worth the price I paid. Upon entering the room, directly in front of you was the closet, and the bathroom was to the right. The bathroom wasn’t huge, but was functional and was equipped with a tub/shower combination (with great water pressure). There was plenty of counter space as well. The room itself was spacious and had a very, very comfortable king size “grand bed” (as seen in the pictures). I slept great each night after coming back from downtown. There was a work desk, 2 large chairs, and plenty of drawer space. There was also a mini-bar, which I did not open or use. The TV was a regular tube TV, but had a good selection of channels, movies etc. There was also a radio, but it was not one of the newer Ipod compatible radios some Hyatt’s have. The temperature control worked pretty well though out my stay. The best part about the room, besides the bed, was my view!! I was able to see two different “landing paths” for O’Hare, with a non-stop flow of planes coming by. The noise at night was not bad at all, once asleep, I could not hear anything. I also had a distant view of downtown over the trees. The windows also open about 4in, which was nice to let the cool air in.
reviews.title: Excellent O’Hare/downtown alternative hotel!!

likes.disliked: — Older TV's

reviews.text: The public areas of the hotel were very nice, I know they just completed a multi-million dollar renovation of the lobby/public areas, and I was very impressed. I did not eat at the main restaurant, but it looked ok. On the last night, I did go to the Red bar, which was pretty cool. They have lots of plasma TV’s to watch sports or whatever. The food was ok, and the drinks were not too expensive. There is also a small, but expensive gift shop on the first floor. There is no pool at the hotel; however, there is a free 24 hour gym.
reviews.title: Great 7 hour Stay

likes.disliked: — N/A

reviews.title: Customer no service
reviews.text: The hotel has a skywalk to the Convention center, and is nearby about 4 other hotels. There are no restaurants or convenience stores that are close by, with the exception of a McDonald's about a mile down the road. The hotel is also very close to the Theatre and there is a 16 screen Muvico theatre complex right down the street. I walked around the area to see what was around, and the area is very clean and safe. Supposedly the city is building the “Rosemont Walk”, a retail/entertainment area around the hotel; however, besides the movie theatres and 2 new hotels, I did not see much else happening. They were supposed to build a large family hotel/indoor water park nearby, but I believe that was cancelled.

The blue line is a very short walk from the hotel, and it takes about 45 minutes to get to downtown. They are doing work on the blue line to speed up the ride, and that should be fully completed in late 2008. The trains come about every 10 minutes. There is a Dunkin Donuts at the Rosemont station, which came in very handy!! Great coffee and great donuts!!!! I did go to the airport to eat dinner one day (food court in the international terminal is before security), and took the shuttle back to the hotel. The shuttles were always running and every time I left or came back to the hotel there were shuttles out front. I took the shuttle back to the airport after checking out and it was very convenient.
reviews.title: Not so great, not so bad

likes.disliked: — No hot water pressure in the shower

reviews.title: They have put some perfume on this hog but it's still a pig
reviews.text: I gave the hotel 4 stars, as I think it has the potential once the rooms get renovated, which from what I understand that is going to happen in 2008. The public areas are up to par with a 4 star hotel. There were a lot of business people staying there, as well as families going to the different sporting events in town. I was very happy with my stay, and thrilled that I paid less than $60 a night to stay there. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would not hesitate to stay there again if I go back to Chicago.
First of all let me start by saying that Hyatt Regency hotels are great. We always try to stay in them because of the great experiences we've had so far.
reviews.title: Not the best Hyatt

reviews.text: That being said, this Hyatt was far from great. I didn't book through the Hyatt website so I didn't pay the $200 some dollars that was listed THANK GOD. But I wasn't expecting to pay $22 a night because their website did say complimentary parking. But when we arrived the person who checked us in said "oh free parking is unheard of in this area". He wasn't friendly at all, and acted a little cocky. I then checked their website and it did say complimentary parking. So I spoke to a girl who was there, and she was very nice and explained to me why its different if I book through a website other than Hyatt etc.
reviews.title: Great accomodations

reviews.text: When we went up to our rooms, it turned out that the cocky help desk guy gave us two doubles instead of a king room. So we had to go back and get it changed again.
reviews.title: They need to invent an elevator to the second floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was not too great at all. The bathrooms were so tiny! this was the first time that I had been to a hotel with no bathtub, just a 2x2 corner with a shower curtain. I mean for a 4 star that's not great at all. Later when we went out to get ice, it turned out that the ice bucked it the room was full of trash from when the last person stayed over. It was just yucky.
reviews.title: showy public spaces, dingy room

reviews.text: On top of that the hotel is designed in a really odd way, which I'm sure some renowned architect is responsible for. In the morning if you are sitting down in the reception, or a restaurant in the lobby and you look up you can see the cleaners going on their house cleaning rounds. In was really not very classy at all. But I guess that's just the design and there's not much they could do about that.
reviews.title: Enjoyed Our Stay

reviews.text: I have never been to a four star hotel that charged for internet. Here? 9.95 for 24 hours through a SEPARATE service. Meaning you can't even put it on your room tab. I know, odd to lead with that one, but it just shows HOW out of touch they are. They're a business travel hotel and the one thing every business traveler needs, they CHARGE EXTRA for and then make complicated in the way you purchase it. Especially for those of us who submit our travel bills when we get back. Now I have to wait a full month for my credit card bill to resubmit it.
reviews.title: In what universe is this a four star hotel?

likes.liked: — There was a very friendly guy who drove the shuttle...but wouldn't stop at the train station
likes.disliked: — Paying for internet access AND doing so on a separate charge from my hotel bill

reviews.title: WAY Better Then Last Time
reviews.text: Okay. On to the other frightening stuff.

Lookswise, this place is one hell of an ugly monolith. The restaurants are all WAY overpriced for the kind of food you could get at homestyle buffet or denny's. There is a fairly new gym, but it's packed to the gills. Clearly they underestimated business travel demand. Parking is 28 bucks a night. It's why I didn't get a rental car while I was there.
reviews.title: Convention Hotel

likes.disliked: — Minor issue of view but there are plenty of rooms with better views

reviews.text: The rooms...the rooms are just not four star quality. I was in a corner room - 1075 - that was tucked into a spot that clearly used to be a broom closet of some sort. I could barely get around the outside of my king size bed in the space it was in.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: Overall, if this was a two star hotel, I'd say, fine. It's crap. You paid 50 bucks for the night, it's fine. But this is somehow listed as a FOUR STAR HOTEL. And there is no way on god's green earth that a statement like that is in any way true. I got my room with a priceline discount and still feel that Hyatt mugged me.
reviews.title: Excellent for Business Travellers!

reviews.text: Had a one day meeting here. Very convenient for the business traveller.
reviews.title: Good Functional Hotel

reviews.text: Took the free shuttle over from O'Hare, about 10 minutes away. Check in was smooth in the attractive atrium lobby. Stayed in the "Executive WIng", which probably would not recommend. It is a walk back to those floors and the rooms were fairly standard. In particular the toilets looked rather ancient in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Perfect for events at the Stephens Convention Center

reviews.text: Service and staff were very pleasant. Forgot toothpaste and it was delivered quickly.
reviews.title: Sleep, Park and Fly is great!

reviews.text: The meeting facilities were terrific for groups up to 50 (based on the rooms that I was in). Good food and coffee. Comfortable seating and work areas.
reviews.title: comfortable, clean hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One additional plus, there is a CTA station roughly 500 yards away. Very quick to get downtown.
reviews.title: A Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: We went to the Hyatt for 3 nights for a show at the convention center. It's my 4th time at this hotel, and I like the rooms and the general hotel a lot. We blew the fuse to our room having two hair dryers going at the same time, which was our fault. They sent a friendly man up immediately that corrected the problem. The front desk called to check with 30 minutes to make sure we were taken care of. They also sent an apology letter with a coupon for a free bakery item, free parking or drink in the hotel, which was completely above and beyond as the issue was our fault. The entire experience at the hotel was great. Friendly service, friendly people.
reviews.title: Great hotel for conference center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I went to Chicago just for the weekend. We came in late Friday night and left early Sunday morning. This hotel was just perfect for us. The free shuttle from the airport got us to our very nice, modern, clean, comfortable room, in less than ten minutes so that we could fall asleep after our long evening of traveling. The next morning, after receiving a map and helpful advice from the front desk, we walked for less than ten minutes to the train station and took the train into downtown Chicago with no problems. It was so easy for us to get in and out of the city, and so convenient to be right by the airport for our early morning flight on Sunday.
reviews.title: Exactly what we needed, and very nice!

reviews.text: We have no complaints at all about this hotel! It was wonderful! Great atmosphere, helpful staff, and a very nice room, especially considering the low price.
reviews.title: Adequate

reviews.text: Adequate to crash in for the night. A few glitches:
reviews.title: Completely Funny and Horrible at the same time

reviews.text: A few things were broken: lamp, TV internet keyboard, but staff replaced them. There was something fishy with the thermostat. Safe is tiny -- laptop did not fit. The airport shuttle schedule is meager -- once an hour. And $10 to use WiFi is off-putting.
reviews.title: Good deal to fly out of O'Hare

reviews.text: I had the opportunity to stay at the Hyatt Regency O'hare courtesy of United Airlines. I stayed for only one night. The room was modern, clean, and comfortable - as expected with a Hyatt Regency. As I had not planned on staying at a hotel that night, I enjoyed the using the toiletries and comfortable robe. Although there appeared to be some sort of Beatles fanclub convention going on, the business tower of the hotel (where my room was located) was quiet. I especially appreciated taking the free shuttle to the airport in the morning.
reviews.title: Nice room!

reviews.text: I needed a room in the O'Hare area for 3 nights and Priceline placed me in this hotel for $58/night. I did quite a bit of research prior to placing my bid and knew there was a very good chance that I'd be place at the Hyatt O'Hare. I was happy with my stay. We had a room in the northeast tower on the 11th floor. The elevator only went to the 10th floor so we had to take the stairs to our room. We checked in early at 1PM and were given the option to wait for a room that didn't need stair access. Stairs aren't that big of deal to me so I took the room. If I ever need a room in the O'Hare area I will be happy if Priceline places me in the Hyatt Regency again. It's not a place that I'd stay if I had kids or was on a family vacation but this Hyatt served it's purpose well.
reviews.title: Comfy Bed and Great Location

likes.disliked: — $17/night parking

reviews.text: Likes:
reviews.title: A/C wasn't working, took four complaints to fix

likes.liked: — Bed/Bedding, cleanliness, furnishings, friendliness of most staff.
likes.disliked: — Price of on-site services, lack of free internet access.

reviews.text: - Extremely comfy bed
reviews.title: Clean, new rooms. Outrageously hideous and dated lobby.

likes.liked: — Clean, new, and comfortable rooms. Great bed!
likes.disliked: — Ugly, dated lobby. Barren location. Understaffed front desk.

reviews.title: Extremely Unsatisfied Customer / Beware Of "Losing" Your Items
reviews.text: - Easy to access hotel from Interstate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed over the weekend to visit Chicago. I drove to the hotel from Iowa. Remember the tolls if you are driving! Some require change on exiting (which I did not have...oops!). I new about the $17/day charge for parking. Bring the ticket to the front desk if you want in and out privileges. The construction is all gone, so don't worry about that. To let you know the pool is also gone...
reviews.title: Mediocre hotel, cheap on Priceline

likes.disliked: — No pool, No free internet, No free parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I parked in parking garage on the 3rd floor, and it was short trip down a corridor to the front desk. The lines to check in can be long if a shuttle bus just came. The rooms are nice enough with a comfortable bed, and the bathroom was nice. There was no free WiFi...$10/day through T-mobile. There is a McDonalds a block north that has free WiFi, but I couldn't connect.
reviews.title: Nothing to brag about

likes.disliked: — Pay to park and horrible location for anyone on foot

reviews.text: I took the airport shuttle to pick up my finance at the airport. Make a note that it can stop at the Hyatt Rosemont before the airport. Took the shuttle back to the hotel. I was a bit confused where to go to pick up the shuttle (the cubs level on the elevator).
reviews.title: Nice rooms, otherwise OK

likes.disliked: — Distance from downtown Chicago

reviews.text: The hotel is a square and consists of rooms around the perimeter around a central lobby. So you can open your door and look down into the lobby below. One problem with this is that it can get noisy from inside the hotel, if there are lots of functions going on. I could hear the airplanes, but it wasn't loud enough to bother me.
reviews.title: Sterile hotel with good shuttle service

likes.liked: — Shuttle service was convenient - no complaints
likes.disliked: — Too much of convention center to feel warm and inviting... Elevators are horrible!

reviews.text: It's a short walk to the Rosemont Blue Line transit station. About like 10 min. Lots of people seemed to be doing this, and there is nothing in the area except hotels, so it was pretty safe. If you are really lazy or can't walk you could take the shuttle to O'hare and take the blue line from there. It's about 30 min to downtown, so bring the paper you get in the morning. There is a dunkin donuts at the station. I recommend the visitor transit pass you can get there. It's unlimited rides on trains and buses.
reviews.title: Good rooms, Bad rooms, Big Surprises

likes.disliked: — Gave away my guaranteed room, put me in a rollaway somewhere.

reviews.text: Stayed here for a company meeting at the end of August. It took 3 different rooms until I was satisfied...........the first had urine all over the toilet in the bathroom, the second was in the "executive wing" which reminded me of an old Howard Johnson hotel room, it was dated, ugly, and had a horrible sounding a/c unit that I just couldn't put up with. Finally, I got a clean room that had been updated. TINY bathroom in the "pod," paper thin walls, and peeling wallpaper sum it up. I ordered room service the first night and the food was quite bad. I would liken it to airline food (when it was served many moons ago). I would not pay any more than necessary i.e. priceline bidding. This hotel is not worth more than $120/night. Parking is ridiculous, and there are much much better choices in the area for less money and much nicer rooms.
reviews.title: Better choices in the vacinity

likes.disliked: — dated, long walk to rooms, tiny bathrooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am not a picky person, but I have to say, this is by far the WORST hotel I have ever stayed at. First of all, we got it thru PriceLine, who voted it a 4 star hotel......I rate it a two. My biggest disappointment, was that this "Four Star" hotel had NO POOL....four star means your one of the best, so you should have everything and more than a crappy hotel. Second, the price you pay on PriceLine, is not accurate....You have to pay 17 dollar a night in addition to the rate, just to park in the parking lot....yes at the hotel that you are a guest at. We were appauled and angry. As we went thru Priceline, looking for a good deal, because we had a small budget to work with, and therefore, we couldn't afford to go to a few of the museums on our schedule...
reviews.title: Warning! Do NOT stay here! Waste of MOney!

likes.disliked: — everything else!

reviews.text: No fan in the bathroom
reviews.title: "Loved it"

likes.disliked: — dated, long walk to rooms, tiny bathrooms

reviews.text: Weird angled room
reviews.title: Terrible!
Great Deal for the Money
reviews.text: Ridiculously Priced food....5 bucks for ONE grapefruit?

description: Discover an iconic O’Hare airport hotel with cutting-edge design and dramatically transformed public space and guestrooms. Groups of all sizes appreciate the grand venues offering innovative catering and unrivaled services at our hotel. Invite friends to join you for cocktails at the enticing Red Bar, or dine in the hip, contemporary O’H American Grill serving mouthwatering traditional American cuisine from around the country. Plush Hyatt Grand BedsTM, deluxe amenities and welcoming touches await you in the remodeled rooms of our exceptional hotel. Guests love our stunning lobby and sunny atrium, easy check-in service, friendly staff and bright, elegant rooms with contemporary décor and high-tech features. Warm yet classy, Hyatt Regency O’Hare boasts an impressive modern aesthetic that speaks to business and leisure travelers alike. With quick access to both O’Hare airport and downtown Chicago, Hyatt Regency O’Hare is the ideal accommodation for every visitor to the Windy City.
